org.stanwood.media.source
Class SearchHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.stanwood.media.source.SearchHelper

public class SearchHelper
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some helper functions that can be used to do things like construct a normalised search query from a file name.

Method Detail

getQuery

public static java.lang.String getQuery(java.io.File mediaFile,
                                        java.lang.String regexpToReplace)
Get a search query from the filename of a file. This will strip out various characters that are not wanted.

Parameters:
regexpToReplace - A regular expression, that when found in the query, is removed. Passing a null value will cause this to be ignored.
mediaFile - The file to which we want to lookup in a source or store
Returns:
The query, or null if the query could not be constructed.

decodeHtmlEntities

public static java.lang.String decodeHtmlEntities(java.lang.String s)
Used to decode HTML entities in strings

Parameters:
s - The string to decode
Returns:
The decoded string

normalizeQuery

public static java.lang.String normalizeQuery(java.lang.String s)
This will normalise a string. It lower cases the string and then replaces any accented characters. Other punciation is removed.

Parameters:
s - The string to normalise
Returns:
The normalised string
